title: Conservation of momentum - rolling marble launcher

content.question: A spring-loaded launcher cart is initially at rest on a horizontal surface, as shown. When the launching mechanism is released, a marble leaves the launcher with speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and the cart moves in the opposite direction with speed <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Frictional forces are negligible. Is the momentum of the launcher-marble system before the launch equal to the momentum immediately after the launch? Why or why not?

choices.label: Yes, because there is no net external force on the system in the horizontal direction.
Yes, because momentum stored in the spring was transferred to the cart and marble.
No, because the total momentum of the system after the launch is greater than before the lunch.
No, because the mechanical energy was zero before launch but greater than zero after launch.

content.answer: Yes, because there is no net external force on the system in the horizontal direction.
